comments:
I want to share a lauch configuration for a JUnit test case. In the dialog 'Debug...' I change the setting in tab COMMON, press Apply, and close. Then a NPE occurs with the following stack trace.

Any hints?
I've searched the bugs for LaunchConfigurationWorkingCopy.writeNewFile, but nothing found.

Best reagrds

Martin Skorsky

eclipse.buildId=M20060629-1905
java.version=1.5.0_07
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=de_DE
Framework arguments:  -showlocation
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -data D:\Exx -showlocation

Error

I have been unable to reproduce this one. Does it happen in any regular way? has it happened since?

The best I can think of is that it is some sort of synchronization issue, as the NPE occurs in a spot after null has been checked for....

It seems entirely possible that LaunchConfiguraitonWorkingCopy#doSave could still be in the middle of writing the new shared file (a workbench job) and by hitting the Apply button on the launch configuration dialog, would call doSave thinking it is still a local file.

Synchronized the method doSave, we'll see if this fixes it.

fixed in HEAD

please verify Darin W
Not sure how to reproduce, but synching the method looks safe.
*** Bug 155472 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
